result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Alfredo Morales Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharge; Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- No use or possession of dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with B.G.B.
- NO CONTACT with A.S.H.

- Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 09-29-2022.
- Complete a Thinking for a Change Course.

- Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges for work and treatment. Report Date: 10-06-2022 by 2:00pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Alfredo Morales Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Alfredo Morales Jr in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Jose Alfredo Morales Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit for days served to be filed at a later time. Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
*-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 9/29/2022.  
*-Serve 60 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and treatment. Report Date: 10/06/2022 by 2:00 pm. 
*-No use or possession of dangerous weapons. 
*-Complete a thinking for a change course.
*-Maintain absolute sobriety.
*-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*-Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
*-No contact with B.G.B.
*-No contact with A.S.H.

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample pay the DNA surcharge.

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Received and Filed.
Court orders the $250.00 cash bail reinstated. All other bail conditions previously ordered remain in effect.
Defendant in court. Attorney Michelle Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Br 13.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($250.00) LW
signed and filed.

Defendant Jose Alfredo Morales in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Jose Alfredo Morales in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Alfredo Morales appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
